  • Method Details

    • newPost

      @PostMapping @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> newPost​(@RequestParam int authorId, @RequestParam int categoryId, @RequestParam java.lang.String title, @RequestParam java.lang.String text)
      Insert a new post into the database according to existing authors and categories
      Parameters:
      title - Post title
      authorId - Id of the registered author
      categoryId - Id of the registered category
      text - Post content
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity - Post to be inserted or error message

    • getPost

      @GetMapping @ResponseBody public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.List<Blog>>> getPost()
      Get all posts and arranges the obtained JSON formated data to be nested
      Returns:
      Map - Formated data

    • getPostById

      @GetMapping("/{id}") @ResponseBody public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.List<Blog>>> getPostById​(@PathVariable int id)
      Get post by id and arranges the obtained JSON formated data to be nested
      Parameters:
      id - Requested id
      Returns:
      Map - Formated data

    • updatePost

      @PutMapping @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> updatePost​(@RequestParam int id, @RequestParam int categoryId, @RequestParam java.lang.String title, @RequestParam java.lang.String text)
      Update a post according to the selected id
      Parameters:
      id - Searched id
      title - New post title
      categoryId - The new post category id
      text - New post content
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity - Successful operation (returns body) or not (not found)

    • deletePost

      @DeleteMapping @ResponseBody public java.lang.String deletePost​(@RequestParam int id)
      Delete one registry of the database
      Parameters:
      id - Searched id
      Returns:
      String - Successfully deleted
